brain.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the organ inside your head that controls how you think, feel, and move
brain.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Messages from the brain are carried by the central nervous system.
She died of a brain tumour.
Emotional responses are a function of the right hemisphere of the brain.
the right/left hemisphere of the brain
brain.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the ability to think clearly and learn quickly
brain.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: If you had any brains, you’d know what I meant.
Something’s addled your brains (=made you confused).
Come on, use your brain, John.
brain.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: someone who is intelligent, with good ideas and useful skills
brain.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Some of our best brains are leaving the country to work in the US.
brain.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the brain of an animal, used as food
brain.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: the ability to think clearly and learn quickly
brain.translation[0].note_box[0].section: You should have more brains than to smoke.
It’s easy if you just use your brain.
If we all rack our brains we should come up with some ideas.
I thought I’d pick Greg’s brains about what to take with us.
it takes/requires brains to do something
It takes brains to think of a plan like that.
The alcohol had addled his brain.
It was obvious that Ann  had a good brain.
brain.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to hit someone very hard on the head – used humorously
